snippet: Radio Free Asia said that four of the people detained after the confrontation in Xinjiang were children, and that they had been part of a group trying to flee the country.
abstract: Radio Free Asia report contradicts Chinese state media concerning lethal shootout that occurred in western region Xinjiang; says police attacked group of ethnic Uighurs who were fleeing country to escape repression, and that those detained after shootout were four children aged 7 to 17; Chinese state media had characterized victims as 'violent terrorists' and kidnappers who were on their way to jihad training across the border.
lead_paragraph: Radio Free Asia said that four of the people detained after the confrontation in Xinjiang were children, and that they had been part of a group trying to flee the country.

headline.seo: New Report of Clash Disputes China’s Account
headline.main: Report of Clash Disputes China’s Account
headline.print_headline: Report of Clash Disputes China’s Account
